intro: Elatostema pseudonanchuanense, commonly known as the narrow-leaf false sandwort, is a species of flowering plant in the family Urticaceae. It is native to China and is characterized by its small, succulent leaves and clusters of tiny white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth or rocky areas. Its leaves are often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in its native habitat. Elatostema pseudonanchuanense is noted for its unique morphology and ecological adaptation to humid, temperate climates.
